__e: Mrs. Fletcher, I know what you think, but you're wrong.
And Dr. Fletcher, I'm sure you have heard of this:
Mrs. Fletcher, I know Dan well enough to know he'd never hurt anyone, no matter what.

But, uh, well, my dear fellow, you know how the boys feel about Fletcher. There might very well be a tremendous demonstration of affection and gratitude... which it would be wrong for me to cut short... difficult for me to cut short, anyhow.
If her dad is right, and Fletcher really fell in love with Elise...
From what you've said, it sounds like Fletcher really is turning that ship around.
